data.title: First edition of 4000 copies
data.meta_description: Sauk City: Arkham House, 1946. First edition of 4000 copies. 8vo, 216, 1 pp. Black cloth with gilt spine lettering and design in illustrated jacket by Robert F. Hubbell. Signed by van Vogt on the title page with Slancere best wishes. Page block edge a bit toned and soiled, with some light foxing to preliminaries, and boards a bit dusty. Price-clipped jacket with toning to spine, typical wear and light chipping at spine
data.text:
van Vogt, A. E.

Slan

Sauk City: Arkham House, 1946. First edition of 4000 copies. 8vo, 216, [1]pp. Black cloth with gilt spine lettering and design in illustrated jacket by Robert F. Hubbell. Signed by van Vogt on the title page with "Slancere" best wishes. Page block edge a bit toned and soiled, with some light foxing to preliminaries, and boards a bit dusty. Price-clipped jacket with toning to spine, typical wear and light chipping at spine ends and corners. A very good copy.

Charmingly signed copy of this first book from the influential Canadian author of science fiction, Alfred Elton van Vogt (1912-2000). Slan was originally published as a serial in John W. Campbell's Astounding Science Fiction, in 1940. A classic Arkham House title from the 40's. Item #6173
